title: Why public EV chargers almost never work as fast as promised
description: Electric vehicle drivers in the US often face slower-than-expected charging speeds at public stations. Factors such as battery idiosyncrasies, temperature extremes, and power-sharing between plugs contribute to this issue. Despite advancements in charging infrastructure, EV owners are advised to prepare for potential delays by using route-planning apps and checking charger reviews.
